description: From school +‎ -ish. Compare Dutch schools (“scholastic, methodical”), German schulisch (“schoolish, scolastic”).

adjectives.description: schoolish (comparative more schoolish, superlative most schoolish)

entries.meaning: Of or pertaining to school; scholastic.
examples: [...] it has studied the trend of the school, but not the trend of business, its leadership has been scholastic, not commercial. Today, commercial education finds itself of the school, schoolish, and not of the business house, business-like.

entries.meaning: Characteristic of school rather than real life; pedantic, pedagogical, etc.
examples: When we reflect on it, many of the things we teachers do are artificial and schoolish. They look very different from how real readers, writers, and speakers operate.
